name: dotSyntax
description: e-mail, IM, & social networking web app
overview:
dotSyntax is the company behind Digsby, a web app that centralizes your e-mail, IM and social networking accounts into one desktop program. Digsby plugs into your AIM, MSN, Yahoo, ICQ, Google Talk, and Jabber accounts, supports multiple email accounts and tracks updates for your Facebook and MySpace accounts.

The company was founded in late 2005 and launched Digsby for Windows in March, ‘08. Mac and Linux versions are forthcoming.

name: Netcipia
tag_list: Monetization, Wiki, Blog, Web-2.0, Communities, Participation, Expertise, Online-Content
overview:
Netcipia offers both free and unlimited wikis and blogs within a single interface (a Netcipia place), and enables its users to charge for the online expertise they provide within their places.

Netcipia place owners can charge their users for their content by offering:

  • Weekly, monthly or yearly subscriptions giving access to the entire Netcipia Place.
  • Fee-based access to specific pages within the Place.
  • Time-limited access to the Place.

Whereas historically, advertisement has been the only way for users of the Web 2?0 to earn some income for the content they provide online, Netcipia enables every professional or expert-amateur to use the power of Web 2.0 participatory features to build, expand and manage participative communities as well as charge for valuable content. In exchange for this service, there are not fixed costs, Netcipia will only charge a percentage for every transaction.

Consultants, teachers, gardeners, architects and so on can use their Netcipia participative communities as a lucrative business tool, using one or several of the three payment models available.

Netcipia therefore offers a Win/Win proposition: Users can benefit from the Netcipia platform free of charge to build their community and offer their content worldwide, until they are able to generate some income by monetizing their content through the use of the Netcipia online expertise monetization platform.

name: WebMD
overview:
WebMD is the leading provider of health information and services to consumers and healthcare professionals. The online healthcare information, decision-support applications and communications services that we provide:

help consumers take an active role in managing their health by providing objective healthcare information and lifestyle information.

make it easier for physicians and healthcare professionals to access clinical reference sources, stay abreast of the latest clinical information, learn about new treatment options, earn continuing medical education credits and communicate with peers.

enable employers and health plans to provide their employees and plan members with access to personalized heath and benefit information and decision support technology that helps them make informed benefit, provider and treatment choices.

name: Covad Communications
overview: Covad is in the business of broadband. As the first company to commercially deploy DSL in the United States, our heritage is broadband innovation. We own and operate the largest national broadband network, and today we are the only national facilities-based provider of data, voice, and wireless telecommunications solutions for small and medium-sized businesses. We are also a key supplier of high-bandwidth access for telecommunications services providers like EarthLink, AOL, and AT&T. Covad broadband and voice over Internet protocol (VoIP) services are currently available in 44 states and 235 major markets and can be purchased by more than 57 million homes and businesses.

name: GlobalEnglish
overview:
GlobalEnglish offers Business English solutions designed to improve the communication and collaboration that drive high performance in a global economy. Without Business English proficiency, global teams are unable to operate successfully across borders, and efficiency and profitability suffer.

GlobalEnglish offers an innovative, cloud-based suite of Business English solutions specifically designed to produce immediate productivity and performance gains enterprise-wide. In blending the latest technology innovations with research on how adults effectively acquire language, GlobalEnglish provides a comprehensive solution: formal and informal Business English learning, instant on-the-job support for business tasks in English, enterprise collaboration, mobile productivity, adaptive Business English assessments, and the ability to measure usage and proficiency improvements across the company.

GlobalEnglish experts located throughout the world help companies maximize the value of their investment through custom analysis and recommendations, coordinated program deployment, and ongoing support in 15 languages.

Headquartered in Brisbane, California, GlobalEnglish has partnered with more than 500 of the world’s leading corporations and enterprises, including BNP Paribas, Capgemini, Deloitte, GlaxoSmithKline, Hilton, John Deere, Procter & Gamble, and Unisys.

GlobalEnglish was acquired by Pearson PLC (UK:PSON), the world’s largest education and publishing company in 2012.

For more information visit www.GlobalEnglish.com.

Harmonix Music Systems, Inc. operates as a videogame development company in Cambridge. It offers music games. The company offers Beatles and Rock Band music games in North America, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand.

Harmonix Music Systems, Inc. was founded in 1995 and is based in Cambridge, Massachusetts. As of October 27, 2006, Harmonix Music Systems, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of MTV Networks Company.

overview: Diversity Limited was founded by Ben Kepes. It is a multifaceted business incorporating investment, entrepreneurship and analysis. It advises organisations on We2.0/SaaS strategies, design strategy and corporate governance.

name: USPTO
overview:
For over 200 years, the basic role of the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) has remained the same: to promote the progress of science and the useful arts by securing for limited times to inventors the exclusive right to their respective discoveries (Article 1, Section 8 of the United States Constitution). Under this system of protection, American industry has flourished. New products have been invented, new uses for old ones discovered, and employment opportunities created for millions of Americans. The strength and vitality of the U.S. economy depends directly on effective mechanisms that protect new ideas and investments in innovation and creativity. The continued demand for patents and trademarks underscores the ingenuity of American inventors and entrepreneurs. The USPTO is at the cutting edge of the Nation’s technological progress and achievement.

The USPTO is a federal agency in the Department of Commerce. The USPTO occupies several interconnected buildings in Alexandria, Virginia. The office employs over 7,000 full time staff to support its major functions— the examination and issuance of patents and the examination and registration of trademarks.

offices.address1: United States Patent and Trademark Office

name: Egnyte
tag_list: file-server, collaboration, hybrid-cloud, online-backup, small-business, soho, small-office, home-office, iphone, blackberry, cloud-computing, box, dropbox
description: Hybrid Cloud File Sharing for Business
overview:
Egnyte is a business-class online solution that completely eliminates the costs and complexity of purchasing and maintaining traditional file servers, tape backups, FTP and VPN systems.

The company was founded in 2006 and is headquartered in Mountain View, California. In July 2012, Egnyte closed a $16 million round of Series C financing led by Google Ventures with additional support from existing investors, Kleiner Perkins Caufield and Byers (KPCB) and Polaris. As a part of this latest funding, Karim Faris, Partner at Google Ventures, will join the board of Egnyte. Egnyte has raised a total of $32 million to date.

Egnyte addresses the critical infrastructure needs of enterprises, small businesses and professionals - file storage, backup, sharing and collaboration - in one secure, centrally-managed and easy-to-use solution. The company’s hybrid cloud technology combines the accessibility and flexibility of cloud storage with the robust performance and speed of local storage, and automatically synchronizes changes made to local and cloud files. Egnyte Cloud File Server ensures that users have reliable and fast access to the files they need anytime and anywhere.

Egnyte has versions for both Windows and Mac, and provides apps for the iPhone, iPad, Android. Egnyte can also be accessed by the native browser of mobile devices (e.g. Blackberry).

funding_rounds.source_description: Egnyte Raises $16 Million From Google Ventures For Cloud File Storage Service
Egnyte Takes On $29.5M In New Capital To Grow Its Enterprise Cloud File Storage Business

overview: ReadItSwapIt is a web based book swapping community. Users log in, make wish lists of books they desire to read or swap, and compare with other users. Users then connect with each other through email and when an agreement to swap is made, the service sends out respective addresses to use during the postage process.

overview:
Tea Traditions caters unique Old English style tea parties for both corporate and personal events.

Their service includes providing linens, china, tea sets and a variety of traditional foods. All foods, including scones, bund cakes, and sandwiches are home made.

T Traditions events can be either set up as table service or buffet style.

name: 51 Give
tag_list: china, microfinance, green, environment, carbon, microloan, sustainable-development
overview:
Supporting those in need is a challenge. It is hard to trust the man on the street begging for money, but it is equally hard to trust the man in a fancy suit promising your money will go to a greater cause than his dinner. It is this obstacle that inspired 51give. 51Give was created with the intention of making it possible to help individuals and make sure the lender feels confident they know what and who their money is being used for.

51give is dedicated to lending money to Chinese social entrepreneurs as well as to rural and urban families to power their lives with renewable technologies. This financial process is referred to as “Sustainable Microfinance”. 51Give is currently running programs in half a dozen Chinese provinces (coastal, rural and urban areas) and is amongst the first to bring sustainable microfinance to China and to provide brand new solutions to the country’s poverty and sustainable development issues.

51Give stands out, because the loans not only alleviate poverty, but improve the environment, reduce carbon emissions, and enhance access to renewable energy in China. Borrowers have used loans to acquire equipment for sustainable businesses such as biogas power, home solar systems, and micro wind power.

51Give is not a charity; it is a social entrepreneurship business that operates on a philosophy of sustainability. By definition, a social enterprise’s activities should be socially good and offer a return on investment. The notion can be taken further by operating a triple bottom-line that stipulates the enterprise’s activities should be good for, or at least not harmful to, the environment. As the age old saying goes, give a man a fish, he eats for a day, teach a man to fish, he eats for life. 51Give promotes micro entrepreneurs engaged in sustainable projects. Poverty is not only about money, it’s also about environmental degradation, hence the emphasis on encouraging loans towards sustainable projects for rural entrepreneurs.

You can learn more about 51Give at the 51give website or the [51give blog] (http://51give.com/blogs/)

name: Frengo
overview:
Frengo is a community where people share buzz - a stream of opinions, updates, questions, predictions and games. The service allows users to follow buzz on their mobile phone or on the website.

In March of 2008, Frengo launched an Open Social Mobile Toolkit that allowed developers to launch mobile applications across Facebook MySpace, Bebo, Hi5 and others.

name: HRSnap! Corporation
tag_list: human-resources, hr, recruiting-management, applicant-tracking-system, job-board-software, career-center, HRSnap
overview:
HRSnap! is a privately held company, based in Nevada with offices throughout the country. The firm specializes in HR software built to serve web content from a desktop computer, without the need for an Internet or database server.

Career Center (tm) was the first product offered by HRSnap! and consisted of a human resources recruiting management and applicant tracking system, allowing businesses to run a job board.

Because the product is not built with .NET, it is compatible with all major web browsers.

name: EasyLink
overview:
EasyLink, based in India, provides a wide range of web services including website design, web application development, website hosting and ongoing maintenance. Its other offerings include setting up intranets/extranets, corporate email hosting, graphics design and multimedia. EasyLink has won several awards such as Ericsson Internet Community Awards, Stockholm Challenge Awards etc. EasyLink’s web designing and software development services have been awarded the ISO 9001:2000 quality certification by JAS-ANZ.

EasyLink has executed projects for a wide range of clients including small entrepreneurs, medium-sized businesses, government departments and educational institutions. EasyLink’s application development team has completed over 750 projects including online web-based applications, client/server applications, multimedia and e-commerce solutions. EasyLink’s web hosting unit currently maintains 15 state-of-the-art Internet servers and hosts more than 5000 websites and web-based databases for its clients.

In addition to catering to clients in India, EasyLink has successful implemented projects for clients in the USA, Canada, UK, Europe and Saudi Arabia. EasyLink also has active partnerships with organizations abroad that resell or market its services.

funding_rounds.source_description: EasyLink Completes $5.4 Million Common Stock Financing.

Recently ranked as the 33rd fastest growing software company in the United States on the Inc. 500 list, Intridea creates highly usable web and mobile applications for today’s enterprise. From startups to the Fortune 500, Intridea counts some of the most exciting and largest companies in the world as clients.

At Intridea we don’t just make web apps - we solve problems. We write intelligently designed software to help businesses develop strategic solutions and launch new ideas. Armed with the brightest engineers and designers and positioned at the forefront of the technological ethos, we help businesses disrupt industries. From napkin to webscale and everything in between - whether you already have a solid idea or need help defining your vision and strategy we can help.

external_links.title: SocialSpring - white label social networking platform

name: Myplaylist
overview:
Myplaylist is a picture / music playlist compiler. Users enter any artist then the search engines will crawl the web, compiling all the images and music that can be found for the band or artist. These will then be compiled into a playlist that can be watched and listened too online or embedded into any web page.

The playlists can be also made manually using the quick register system (no email required) then the user has total control over the images and music which they compile their playlist with.

Other interesting features include : 1) did you mean ‘correct spelling’ function for incorrect spellings, 2) upon completing a playlist, the system will search through all its data to discover the most similar playlist to the previous, and continue playing playlists within the genre first selected.

name: Guitarati
tag_list: guitarati, online-music, music-discovery, music-color-relationship, music, intuitive-music-discovery
overview:
Guitarati is an online music store with an unconventional color based approach to music discovery.

Musical notes can elicit diverse emotions and each emotion can be mapped to a color. So when someone is looking for soothing music, they may be more likely to pick softer colors and in the same way, softer-colored music. In the same vein, Guitarati users can follow their instinct by picking colors and quickly find music they actually like. While they listen to a song, they can also mark it with various colors they are intuitively attracted to. Each song thus has a dominant color, resulting from collective color markings.

The music is offered in DRM free mp3 format. Users can listen to 192 kbps or better full-length songs or free samples. They pay 1 cent for each full-length song streaming, and these cents get deducted from the download price when they download the song.

Guitarati provides multiple revenue streams for bands and labels, as they get paid for song downloads as well as streaming. They decide the price of their music and retain 75% of the earnings. Record labels can manage their entire roster and earnings through a single dashboard. The website is free to use and there are no hosting or registration fees.

name: Skewz
overview:
Skewz combines the functionality of social news and bookmarking sites like Digg and del.icio.us, but places a political spin on the stories and links submitted. After a news story is submitted, users are able to vote on which side of the liberal/conservative fence the article or link sits relative to their political views. Users can also rate their conservative/liberal leaning on a variety of issues in the political arena, and also see the political skew of the various sites that articles are submitted from. A number of services are beginning to pop up in anticipation of the 2008 General Election, with Microsoft launching a similar service called Blews and VoteOften.us also offering similar functionality.

In June 11, 2008, Skewz launched its Election 2008 Media Insight Report, which uses the Company’s technology and data analysis to find media bias trends in the political media.

name: GameVee
overview:
GameVee is a user submitted gameplay video sharing community. Users can upload their gameplay videos to share with other gamers as well as vote and comment on them.

GameVee also gives users the ability to highlight a part of a video’s timeline to show other users what specific part they are referring to during discussions.

Source: http://www.gamevee.com/features

video_embeds.embed_code: Halo 3 odst fun

name: Davinci Selectwork
overview:
DAVINCI Selectwork offers strategic communication planning tools that allow integrated, 360° campaigns to actually happen.

In collaboration with clients and agencies, DAVINCI builds communication platforms stemming from deep consumer understanding. Touchpoints are activated how, when and where the consumer is most receptive to the brand message.

relationships.title: Global Director Online and Mobile Communications

name: BuzzologySurveys
overview:
BuzzologySurveys is an African American owned consumer research and marketing group based outside of Seattle, WA. Our online community with its timely surveys, news and other information covers everything from spending habits, media, technology, politics, lifestyles and other issues impacting every day life.

Our company’s purpose is two-fold, to create an exciting and informative forum for visitors and ensure corporations and other organizations have needed data on the African American demographic.

BuzzologySurveys’ blog also gives more details on the pulse of the black buying public, updates on celebrity endorsements deals, business and entertainment news, and other happenings from around the web.

name: MyWellnessSpace
overview: MyWellnessSpace.com is an online community where individuals can come together to share their wellness goals, life dreams, and experience and knowledge about being well.

name: Austhink Software
tag_list: critical-thinking-software, decision-mapping, argument-mapping, austhink, bCisive, Rationale, workplace-decision-making, reasoning, decisions, visual-thinking
overview: Austhink Software was founded in 2004 by Tim van Gelder, an Australian cognitive scientist. Austhink develops software supporting critical thinking and decision making, in both business and education. In its software, it uses argument mapping, the use of graphical techniques for handling complex argumentation. Argument mapping has been shown in extensive research to be very effective in building critical thinking skills.

name: Teet
overview: Teet is a prize giveaway site based in Latvia. The site uses fairly complex gameplay to increase the time users spend on the site. A giveaway is offered 24/7, and by “rolling a dice” when a timer stops, a random user ends up winning the prize. Points are also allocated by dice-rolls, as well as correctly guessing when the timer will stop. Point leaders at the end of the month are awarded “teets” which are assigned a dollar value, and can be used to buy other merchandise, with free shipping worldwide.

name: PutPlace
overview: PutPlace puts intelligence around your files in the cloud and lets you store the files anywhere you want. That includes storing it with with PutPlace’s storage service itself, on Amazon S3, or your own cloud storage service.

name: TripSay
tag_list: travel, travel2-0, web2-0, travel-planning, travel-community, web-2-0, travel-2-0, finland
overview: TripSay is about sharing and discovering experiences with people you know or at least can trust as you can compare your interests and experiences easily with theirs. It is targeted for passionate travelers who want to get travel tips and recommendations from friends and like-minded travelers and also share their own with others. It’s about creating a network of trusted travelers sharing your taste and receiving new tips and recommendations from them. It is not about finding cheapest flights or hotels nor is it about finding anonymous reviews on hotels and restaurants. It’s about finding easily what is needed and enjoying the process of doing so.

name: DoppelMe
overview: DoppelMe has been put together by a rag-tag group of artists and web designers in London, UK. Frustrated at the lack of utilities available to be able to create good looking avatars, they set about creating what you now see before you.

name: izzyme
overview: IzzyMe is a web based classified site that combines traditional sales and trades through classified ads and social networking. In this way, users are free to make their purchasing decisions among a personalized group within their social networks or those they establish within the site. The company is based in Kirkland, Washington.

name: GroupSpaces
overview: GroupSpaces is a London-based company developing technology to help real-world groups and communities manage and promote themselves online. Today its software helps manage over 1 million memberships for sports clubs, charities, university societies, national associations and many other groups. GroupSpaces was founded in 2007 by David Langer and Andy Young, frustrated with their experiences managing groups while at Oxford University. GroupSpaces is funded by Index Ventures and a consortium of Angel Investors including Simon Levene, Dave McClure, Chris Sacca, Quincy Smith, Meagan Marks, Stephen Bullock and Avonmore Developments.,mk;nio [‘ub hkb ji ;oh ;o8b .

In one year, HBG publishes approximately 650 adult books, 150 young adult and children’s books, and 100 audio book titles. Abrams, Amazing People Club, Chronicle Books, Filipacchi Publishing, Gildan Media, Guinness World Records, Hachette UK, InnovativeKids, Marvel, Octopus Books, Oxmoor House, Peterson’s, Phaidon Press, Time Inc. Home Entertainment, an Windblown Media.

name: XtraGlobex
tag_list: globalization, integrated-marketing-communications, philadelphia-marketing-firm, competitive-advantage, strategic-business-development-company, public-relations-agency
overview: XtraGlobex is a strategic business development firm based in Philadelphia, with clients and activities all over the globe. They specialize in business development that focuses on communications, technology, and globalization.

name: utoopia
overview: utoopia helps you decide what you want to buy. All product information and personalized recommendations are generated by humans. Unlike its competitor, utoopia is focused on the providing answers to questions that can’t be answered by objective factors such as existing product attributes and information.

name: South Park Studios
overview:
South Park Studios, a joint venture between South Park creators Matt Stone and Trey Parker and Comedy Central, allows fans of South Park to stream any episode of the popular television series.

Revenues from the joint venture are being split 50/50 between Comedy Central and Stone/Parker.

name: Asaph
overview: Asaph is a microblogging system, that allows you to instantly post links and images directly from any page on the web.

name: Business News Americas
tag_list: latinamerica, news, business, mining, metals, oil, gas, infrastructure, telecom, banking, insurance, privatization, water-and-waste
overview: Bilingual online news service that covers important original stories in 12 different business sectors throughout Latin America and the Caribbean. A team of 60 journalists and researchers located throughout the region bring relevant news affecting Latin America’s principal emerging economies every business day. The subscription based service includes daily English and Spanish regional news coverage, a directory of company profiles, 12 year content library of third party research reports, regional events calendar and an online store to purchase intelligence reports.

name: Zong
tag_list: mobile-framework, open-framwork, mobile-apps, mobile-payment, mobile-payments, payment, payment-systems, payment-system
overview:
Zong, the leading mobile payment service used by online gaming and social networking web sites, converts shoppers into buyers at rates up to 10 times greater than traditional payment methods.

Zong leverages direct connections with mobile network operators around the world to provide a secure payment solution with unrivaled connectivity and service quality. Zong is the mobile payment provider for Facebook Credits and also works with hundreds of leading destination websites and mobile applications including Gaia Online, IMVU and Playdom.

Reaching over 3.2 billion mobile users, Zong provides localized payment capabilities in close to 50 countries in 21 languages. Zong is the only mobile payments platform that combines the high conversion rates of carrier billing with the low costs and flexibility of payment card networks.

In 2011, Zong announced the first one-click mobile payment solution for the Android platform so developers could integrate payment options into their applications. The new payment solution creates a seamless experience for users who can now make a purchase within an application with just one click; no registration or log-in is required. The Zong platform automatically verifies the user, bills their mobile phone account and returns them to their application or game without delay.

In 2009, Zong processed mobile payments for over 10 million unique users worldwide. In October 2009 Zong released Zong+ which combines the high conversion rates of mobile payments with the low costs of payment card networks. Zong+ received the Frost+Sullivan Best Practices Award for product innovation and was dubbed a “potential Paypal killer” by TechCrunch.

In early 2010 Zong was spun off from Switzerland-based Echovox. Echovox shareholders received shares in Zong, a U.S. corporation. Zong is backed by Advent Venture Partners, Newbury Ventures and Matrix Partners.

products.name: Hosted Mobile Payments for Web apps
Open API for transaction based messaging services
1-touch in-app payment service on Android mobile devices

Travelocity is a subsidiary of Sabre Holdings Corporation.

The Leader in Global Mobile Engagement mBlox helps brands, agencies and solution providers create meaningful connections with their customers on mobile devices anytime and nearly anywhere.

Our network of over 800 mobile operators around the world enables businesses to reach nearly 5 billion consumers.

We make it easy to use interactive SMS text message campaigns, push notifications and geolocation in order to drive revenue, lifetime customer value and ROI.

name: BullPoo
overview: BullPoo is one of the pioneering websites in the field of social networking for finance and stock enthusiasts. It offers an interactive platform for investors to create investment profiles, share stock blogs, apply investment tools and communicate (in real-time) with other investors within a community of international users. Its virtual trading platform also compliments its social networking features by allowing investors to act on their content, sharing their virtual portfolio, stock picks and stock performance. Investors are also able to join one or more participating networks, such as investment clubs and others.

name: SacStarts
overview: SacStarts is a growing community of entrepreneurs in the Sacramento region that aims to build and strengthen relationships among local entrepreneurs, technologists, and early stage companies.

name: Pheedo
overview: Pheedo is a distributed media advertising network, working with publishers and advertisers to maximizes their ROI through its RSS ad serving technology. Founded in 2003, Pheedo provides in-feed advertising services to New York Times, CNet, Inc and Washington Post. They have offices in the San Francisco Bay Area, Portland, OR, and Tokyo. Pheedo received strategic investment from Transcosmos Investments & Business Development.

name: Lockergnome
overview: Lockergnome is a blogging network, with posts from many contributors offering technology tips. Lockergnome originally started as a technology mailing list in 1996, offering tricks and tips for operating systems and applications, software suggestions (with an emphasis on public domain and shareware software) and web site recommendations. Several mailing lists are now provided, offering technology tips and other content syndicated from Lockergnome’s blogs and web forums, including IT Professionals and problem solvers.

name: HelpMeSue
tag_list: law, lawsuit, legal, marketplace, reviews, lawyer, trial, class-action, sue, justice, anonymous, demand-aggregation, courtroom
overview:
Founded in December 2007, HelpMeSue is a free and anonymous aggregator for legal services. HelpMeSue helps users share their legal grievances with a community of other citizens and lawyers. It strives to help lawyers by collecting all types of potential lawsuits - from class action and personal injury to property and commercial lawsuits - in one place.

Kevin Yu and Brian Schneider launched HelpMeSue with the altruistic goal of “helping average Americans seek Justice.”

name: GuardianEdge Technologies
overview:
GuardianEdge, the leader in endpoint data protection, enables enterprises to safeguard confidential and proprietary data, ensure regulatory compliance, and securely mobilize computing environments. The award-winning GuardianEdge Data Protection Platform combines managed encryption and device control technologies to protect data on laptops, desktops, portable storage devices, and smartphones. GuardianEdge solutions have been deployed by leading enterprises such as Lockheed Martin, Providence Health Services, and The Hertz Corporation to protect millions of users worldwide. GuardianEdge government customers include the Internal Revenue Service; the U.S. Departments of Defense, Education, Justice, State, Treasury, and Veteran Affairs; the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps; as well as numerous state and local government agencies.

The company was founded in 2002 and is based in San Mateo, California.

acquisition.source_description: Symantec to Offer Broadest Data Protection Capabilities With Acquisition of PGP Corporation and GuardianEdge

name: FoxyTunes
overview:
FoxyTunes began in August 2004 as a Firefox toolbar extension allowing users to control all major media players on all major platforms from their browser. Since then FoxyTunes has added support for more than 30 music players and operability on Mozilla Thunderbird, Seamonkey, Flock, and Microsoft’s Internet Explorer. Customizable buttons and skins have also been added, as well as numerous additional features such as album cover displays and twitter/song status signatures.

The company plans to expand its business from the simple extension with its creation of FoxyTunes Planet, a music portal and “personalized music aggregator” that integrates with the extension as well as numerous major music services and providers.

FoxyTunes was acquired by Yahoo in February 2008 for an undisclosed sum amidst a shakeup of the Yahoo Music property.

name: MyCyberTwin
overview:
MyCyberTwin is a service that allows you to create virtual personalities called CyberTwins.

The service was launched in April 2007.

name: JIxperts
overview: Jixperts’ idea is to build “wikipedia you can talk to”. Instead of writing articles users can make chat-bots and teach them with answering questions. Otherwise users can receive information by having conversation with virtual characters or experts.

name: Agoracom
tag_list: investor-relations, finance, small-cap-stocks, saas, community, discussion-forums, investing
overview:
Agoracom is a second generation online financial community that has eliminated epidemic levels of spam, stock bashing and profanity from stock discussion forums, a dynamic that has plagued all first generation financial communities.

In October 2008, AGORACOM reported traffic of 101 million page views from 1.2 million unique visitors and 7.6 million total visits.

AGORACOM has generated 7-digit revenues and profits in 2008 without any revenues from advertising.

Source:AGORACOM

name: Obvious
overview:
The Obvious Corporation creates technology systems to facilitate the process of collaboration between people to improve the world. Obvious believes that technology has the power to affect individuals, organizations, and society if implemented the right way. After creating Twitter and Odeo, Obvious is being relaunched to bring the world more products that matter including Medium.

Obvious Corp. was founded in 2006 and is based in San Francisco, California.

Odeo is a podcasting service and is a division of SonicMountain, a digital media company.

Odeo is SonicMountain’s “portal through which they plan to unveil new tools and utilities that improve the podcasting experience.”

name: Absolute Software
tag_list: it-asset-management, secure-asset-tracking, remote-data-delete, computer-theft-recovery, laptop-tracking, computer-security-software
overview: Absolute Software Corporation creates computer theft recovery, data protection and Secure Asset Tracking solutions. Absolute’s Computrace software is embedded in the BIOS of computers by global leaders, including Dell, HP, Lenovo, MPC, Toshiba and Fujitsu, and the Company has reselling partnerships with these OEMs and others, including Apple and Sony.

acquisitions.source_description: Absolute Software to Acquire LiveTime Software

milestones.description: Absolute Software Acquires FailSafe and Freeze Anti-Theft Assets from Phoenix Technologies
milestones.source_text:
VANCOUVER, April 8 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ - Absolute(R) Software Corporation ("Absolute" or the "Company") (TSX: ABT), the leading provider of firmware-based, patented, computer theft recovery, data protection and secure IT asset management announced today that on April 7, 2010 it purchased the technology assets of FailSafe(R) and Phoenix Freeze(TM) from Phoenix Technologies Ltd. ( PTEC).
FailSafe is a competitive theft deterrence product that provides users the ability to protect, track, and manage their laptop and its files if it is ever lost or stolen. Freeze allows users to lock and unlock an XP or Vista based laptop when they walk away from it and unlock it when they return. Freeze is Bluetooth(R)-enabled; once a user steps out of the "zone of safety" their laptop is locked and their data protected. Absolute will integrate certain components of the acquired technology into its industry leading Computrace(R) LoJack(R) for Laptops solution to extend its data protection and theft recovery capabilities.
"This asset acquisition enhances our competitive position in the market and reaffirms our commitment to the anti-theft space," said John Livingston, CEO. "These two products provide some additional features we can incorporate into our existing suite of services. We will also use this acquisition as an opportunity to expand our computer manufacturer (OEM) relationships and embedded positions. We have long valued our OEM relationships and the acquisition of FailSafe and Freeze solidifies our leadership position with these key partners."
Under the terms of the asset purchase agreement, Absolute paid approximately US$6.9 million in cash.
About Absolute Software
Absolute Software Corporation (TSX: ABT) is the leader in tracking, managing and protecting computers and mobile devices. The Company's Computrace, Absolute Manage and LoJack(R) for Laptops solutions provide theft recovery, data protection and computer lifecycle management capabilities to organizations and consumers. The Company's software agent is embedded in the firmware of computers by global leaders, including Acer, ASUS, Dell, Fujitsu, General Dynamics Itronix, HP, Lenovo, Motion, Panasonic and Toshiba, and the Company has reselling partnerships with these OEMs and others, including Apple. For more information about Absolute Software, please visit www.absolute.com and
milestones.source_description: Absolute Software Acquires FailSafe and Freeze Anti-Theft Assets from Phoenix Technologies

name: Cellfish
tag_list: mobile-app-development, social-apps, digital-media-publisher, music-discovery, mobile-web, social-discovery, big-data, smartphone-apps
overview:
Cellfish designs and develops innovative mobile and social applications, focused on delivering high-value and engaging experiences to music, sports and entertainment fans. Since 2004, the company has been creating and distributing original and licensed content and applications through its own marketing network, as well as through partnerships with the leading operators, media companies and app stores. Cellfish reaches millions of fans around the world through Cellfish Studios, offering sports- and entertainment-focused mobile content and applications, and Bandsintown, a top-rated concert discovery app on Facebook and mobile for live music fans and artists.

The company was founded by Fabrice Sergent and Julien Mitelberg and is headquartered in New York City.

tag_list: DotHomes, BytePlay, real-estate, search-engine, Krymski, de-Jager
overview: DotHomes.com is a real estate search engine. Launched in mid-2006, DotHomes allows home seekers across the US, UK and South Africa to search real estate Websites. DotHomes employs an advertising business model. DotHomes is the first search engine to be launched by London-based search company, BytePlay Limited.

name: groSolar
overview:
groSolar is North America’s premier distributor, installer and integrator of solar energy solutions for residential and commercial installations. Founded in 1998, groSolar now encompass offices and warehouses across the continent, distributing solar electric and solar hot water systems.

groSolar integrates components from leading solar manufacturers including Evergreen Solar, PanelClaw, Motech, Heliodyne, SMA, Fronius and UniRac into simple solar energy solutions for customers that generate clean, reliable energy for decades. groSolar is a mission-driven company dedicated to providing high quality solar energy solutions and whole energy appreciation. groSolar’s venture capital investors include NGP Energy Technology Partners, SJF Ventures, and Calvert Social Investment Fund.

CEO & Member of Board of Directors

name: eSolar
overview: eSolar has developed a solar thermalpower plant technology. eneration can be scaled from 46 MW to over 500 MW. eSolar’s modular, scalable power plant architecture enables custom built facilities with generating capacities of 46 MW to 500 MW and energy prices that are competitive with fossil fuels. eSolar systems provide competitive energy prices even at the 46 MW level, and can expand generation capacity to over 500 MW to meet the needs of any energy retailer. eSolar constructs power plants using a tiered delivery model. The power plants are structured on a 46 MW base unit, called a “power module.”

name: Simkl
tag_list: im, store-ims, aim, icq, msn, yahoo-im, search, archive, chat, logs, history, enterprise
overview:
Simkl automatically saves all of your important IM conversations on a secured web server, the same way you save your e-mails.

Since 2007, Simkl has been focused on recording and storing data that’s important to you. Within a year, Simkl developed its brand locally in various foreign countries (Simkl.com, Simkl.de, Simkl.es, Simkl.co.uk, Simkl.ru, Simkl.ua…) in 11 languages and established a distinctive position of the brand in the IM storage market for Simkl IM Chat & Voice Recorder. In 2013 Simkl released it’s Skype recorder as a completely free software with premium cloud storage option for all Skype recordings.

Today, Simkl develops a range of new high-quality services and products for different IM platforms and is a leader in online storage for ICQ chat history, Skype chat history and Skype voice recordings. Company is passionate about innovating in IM text and voice archiving technologies and communication products.

name: Engago Technologies
overview:
Engago Technologies is a privately held software company based in UK, which aims to develop and operate web services for companies.

Committed to the “less is more” principle, LEADSExplorer www.LEADSExplorer.com is the first available service which uses the in-house developed Appmetrx technology.

The web service LEADExplorer combines lead generation from the customers’ company website, CRM and Internet data mining.

In 7 out of 10 B2B deals, the potential buyer will start with a search on the Internet for vendor and product selection. Thus the website visits are the first sign of a possible lead. LEADSExplorer identifies the visitor by company name and reveals the interest in products or services by search terms used and pages visited. This allows for visitor qualification. In order to proceed with contacting the lead and lead nurturing using the Internet data mining tools will help to find possible contacts and background information on the company.

Cold calling upon these companies, will be more effective.

By visually matching the website visits by company with the contact history of events (emails, telephone calls, meetings, etc.) the level of interest can be analyzed and the message can be adjusted.

At the same time using this visual representation will allow for lead qualification, lead management and defining the funnel.

Both website leads and ‘real world’ leads can be managed within the CRM, as real world leads will also generate website visits.

name: Health-Smart
overview: Health-Smart develops personal interactive healthcare platforms to manage monitor and treat chronic conditions, enabling clinicians to monitor and help their patients remotely and empowering people to monitor, assess and improve their health and quality of life.

name: Pure Digital Technologies
tag_list: video, camcorder, flip, ultra, myspace, youtube, aol-video
overview:
Pure Digital Technologies is the provider of innovative imaging solutions for the mass market, including the Flip Video family of digital camcorders.

The Flip Video camera is a simple digital camcorder designed especially for Internet video sharing. The camera contains on-board software enabling one-click uploads to YouTube, AOL Video, MySpace and other websites. The latest model, the Flip Ultra, has been the best-selling camcorder on Amazon.com since the day of its debut, capturing about 13% of the camcorder market.

It captures video in 640x480 resolution at 30 frames per second. It uses 2 AA batteries. It lacks a memory card extension slot but can be connected to a computer with its pop-out USB connector, without the need for a cable. It is simple to use, lacking most of the features of more advanced cameras. Depending on memory size, the current (“Ultra”) model camera retails for $150 (1 GB flash memory for about 30 minutes of video) or $180 (s2 GB flash memory).

Pure Digital Technologies was acquired in 2009 by Cisco, and in April 2011 Cisco announced it was shutting down the Flip line.

funding_rounds.source_description: A disposable digital camera enters the market at $19.99

milestones.source_description: The Video Camera Revised

milestones.description: PureDigital Unveils Flip Ultra series
milestones.source_description: Pure Digital Technologies Introduces the Flip Video Ultra Series

name: LoftCity
overview:
LoftCity an online film studio designed for the creation of short affordable professional films. LoftCity is a global community of young professional filmmakers.

In LoftCity, each filmmaker gets a virtual studio, which is called Loft. In their lofts, filmmakers can showcase their creations in all media formats including video, audio, photography and writings.

LoftCity empower filmmakers with a unique technology: a complete and intuitive set of online production management tools that make organizing the production process easy to manage and track through every stage of its development from treatment to release. LoftCity uses classical filmmaking methodologies in a new online environment enabling global collaboration-based filmmaking.

Filmmakers can initiate their own productions or they can answer Calls for Production. Calls for Productions are commissioned projects by either LoftCity or third parties such as advertising agencies, internet TV networks or mobile service providers.

name: Axosoft
overview:
Axosoft is a provider of bug tracking and software project management applications for software development teams. Company’s flagship product is OnTime.

Axosoft was founded in 2002 by someone who needed to figure out, “Who is working on what?!” As a senior consultant and project manager, Hamid Shojaee built OnTime for himself. Then he started giving it away free. Before long, hundreds of people were using OnTime… and requesting new features. Fortunately, they were even willing to pay for it, so Hamid founded Axosoft. Today Axosoft has two main products: OnTime and TransferBigFiles.com—both leaders in their respective markets.

name: SoftLogica
overview: SoftLogica focuses on the development, marketing and support of file and network management tools and utilities.

name: Jotlet
overview:
Jotlet provides online calendaring software for personal and business usage.

Jotlet calendars can be synced with Outlook and integrated into websites using a JavaScript API.

name: Trellon
tag_list: web, social-networking, socialmedia, drupal, open-source, cms, ecommerce, blogging
overview:
Trellon (pronounced “Trel-Ahn”) is a consulting firm specializing in social networking and online community web portals. The company was founded in 2004 by Michael Haggerty and Andrew Hoppin, veterans of the Clark for President campaign.

The company has significant expertise working with Drupal and CiviCRM and has made contributions to each platform. Their clients include a number of international media organizations, various non-profits and NGOs, political groups and commercial ventures. The services offered by Trellon include web site development, product testing, training for individuals and organizations, decision support and strategic consulting.

name: Misohoni
overview:
Misohoni is a Hong Kong based company, involved in Web Applications and Services.

The most recent site launched is Uncover England, an England specific directory where businesses are free to submit their listings with or without a site. Since the launch in September 2010, there are already 3000 registered listings.

name: Coull
tag_list: video, online-advertising, web-2-0, video-advertising, hypervideo, embed, track-video, product-links, affiliate, publisher, advertiser, video-network, video-perofrmance, perofmrance-marketing, revupnet
description: We are a Video Performance Network
overview:
Video is riding on the crest of a wave right now, and we share your passion for brilliant content. Our clients are global publishers and bloggers who want to turn their video content into an income or revenue stream without compromising on the things that make that content great. For advertisers we open up unique new opportunities to reach audiences by integrating branded vidlinks within premium video from these content creators.

Our unique technology is built on understanding how people really want to interact with video – online and on the move. For us, it’s all about simplicity and engagement. For you, it just works.

milestones.description:
April 13, 2012
Coull acquire RevUpNet to establish US presence

   

Coull, which is the sole video partner of Google Affiliate Network, is acquiring California based RevUpNet, an established and profitable online marketing agency, for $2 million.
milestones.source_description: Coull acquire RevUpNet to establish US presence

name: Enomaly
overview:
Enomaly Elastic Computing Platform, Service Provider Edition

Enomaly’s Elastic Computing Platform (ECP) is the answer for service providers that want to leverage the power, flexibility, and compelling economics of cloud computing.

Enomaly ECP Service Provider Edition is a complete “cloud in a box” solution, enabling telcos and hosting providers to deliver revenue-generating Infrastructure-on-demand (IaaS) cloud computing services to their customers, quickly and easily, with a compelling and highly differentiated feature set.

The Service Provider Edition of Enomaly ECP provides a powerful but simple customer self-service portal, integrates with your billing and provisioning systems, and leverages our robust orchestration and provisioning engines.

name: Marin Software
overview: Marin Software™ is a leading provider of online advertising management solutions, offering an integrated platform for managing search, display, and social marketing. The company provides solutions for advertisers and agencies of all sizes, enabling them to improve financial performance, save time, and make better decisions. Marin Enterprise, the company’s flagship product, addresses the needs of online marketers spending $100,000 per month and greater on biddable media. Marin Professional delivers the same power and ease of use as Marin Enterprise, through an application designed for marketers spending less than $100,000 per month on paid search. Headquartered in San Francisco, with offices worldwide, Marin’s technology powers marketing campaigns for over 1,500 customers managing more than $3.5 billion of annualized ad spend in more than 160 countries.
